Grid Tools¶

Module level methods¶

grid_tools.resample_and_convolve(f, wg_raw, wg_fine, wg_coarse, wg_fine_d=0.35, sigma=2.89)[source]¶

Take a full-resolution PHOENIX model spectrum f, with raw spacing wg_raw, resample it to wg_fine (done because the original grid is not log-linear spaced), instrumentally broaden it in the Fourier domain, then resample it to wg_coarse. sigma in km/s.

Exceptions¶

exception grid_tools.GridError(msg)[source]¶
exception grid_tools.InterpolationError(msg)[source]¶

Grid Interfaces¶

class grid_tools.RawGridInterface(name, points, air=True, wl_range=[3000, 13000], base=None)[source]¶

Takes in points, which is a dictionary with key values as parameters and values the sets of grid points.

check_params(parameters)[source]¶

Checks to see if parameter dict is a subset of allowed parameters, otherwise raises an AssertionError, which can be chosen to be handled later..

load_file(parameters, norm=True)[source]¶

Designed to be overwritten by an extended class

class grid_tools.HDF5Interface(filename, mode=None)[source]¶

Connect to an HDF5 file that stores spectra.

load_file(parameters)[source]¶

Loads a file and returns it as a LogLambdaSpectrum. (Does it have to assume something about the keywords? Perhaps there is a EXFlag or disp type present in the HDF5 attributes.

Grid Creator¶

class grid_tools.HDF5GridCreator(GridInterface, filename, wldict, ranges={'logg': (-inf, inf), 'alpha': (-inf, inf), 'Z': (-inf, inf), 'temp': (0, inf)}, parallel=True, nprocesses=4, chunksize=1)[source]¶

Take a GridInterface, load all spectra in specified ranges (default all), and then stuff them into an HDF5 file with the proper attributes.

Interpolators¶

class grid_tools.IndexInterpolator(parameter_list)[source]¶

Index interpolator should return fractional index between two points (0 - 1) and the low and high values. For example, given “temp”:6010, the index interpolator should return (0.1, 6000, 6100). Then we create a structure that has {“temp”: (0.1, 6000, 6100), “logg”: (0.7, 3.5, 4.0), etc.... }

If the interpolation request is right on a grid point, say for example 6100., it will return ((6100., 6100),(1.0, 0.0))

If the interpolation request is out of bounds, it will raise an InterpolationError

class grid_tools.Interpolator(interface, cache_max=256, cache_dump=64, avg_hdr_keys=None)[source]¶

Naturally interfaces to the HDF5Grid in its own way, built for model evaluation.
